TopicTitle: Can you disable displayed orbits of planets/moons?

Articles.Content:
So I'm trying to take some scenic screen shots and video clips from Map View but the shown orbital paths of all the planets/moons (as well as the dots that highlight their location in the sky) are kinda fugly. I couldn't find anything in settings.cfg that was obvious. Is it possible to disable them?

=Smidge=

Edited November 16, 2013 by Smidge204
Use the staging view. The orbit map, well it's an orbit map, so it has map stuff on it.

If I use the staging view then the ship/probe is in the way.

Map view is nearly ideal. I've hacked a probe body out in a 300,000M orbit around Kerbol just so I can get out of the KSC screen, and I can focus on the various planets/moons to get nice clean pictures... except for the orbits/"dots" being displayed.

=Smidge=
Long story short, you can't do that without a mod. In stage view, just zoom out. Way out. You won't even be able to see the ship.

You can also middle-click and drag to move your ship out of the way, though you can't move it all the way off the screen.

Best choice is to zoom way out though. At inter- (or even most intra-) planetary distances, your scene will essentially be the same zoomed out as it was zoomed in.

Well balls... I'll have to make do with zooming out and fiddling with orbital heights to get the right angles I guess. Not quite prepared to delve into modding just for this!

Thanks anyway!

=Smidge=
